metadata.lecture_topic: В примере с погодой, вычисли F(да) для теста.

turns.content: В примере с погодой, вычисли F(да) для теста.

turns.model_response:
To compute F(yes) for the test in the weather example, we first need to calculate the logarithm of the prior probability P(Class=yes), which is the proportion of games that took place with the given conditions among all games:

P(Class=yes) = Number of games where conditions match the test / Total number of games
= 5 / 20 = 0.25

Next, we calculate log P(X_i | Class=yes), the logarithm of the conditional probability of each feature given that the game took place:

* Log P(X1=rainy | Class=yes) = log (Number of games where conditions match the test AND X1=rainy / Number of games where conditions match the test)
= log (5 / 5) = 0
* Log P(X2=cold | Class=yes) = log (Number of games where conditions match the test AND X2=cold / Number of games where conditions match the test)
= log (3 / 5) ≈ -0.48
* Log P(X3=humid | Class=yes) = log (Number of games where conditions match the test AND X3=humid / Number of games where conditions match the test)
= log (4 / 5) ≈ -0.26
* Log P(X4=windy | Class=yes) = log (Number of games where conditions match the test AND X4=windy / Number of games where conditions match the test)
= log (3 / 5) ≈ -0.48

Now, we sum up all these terms:
F(yes) = log P(Class=yes) + Sum log P(X_i | Class=yes)
= 0 + (-0.48 - 0.26 - 0.48)
= -1.22

This value can be used to compare with F(no) and determine the class of the test based on the learned model.
